               An update of the 1932 film, Scarface (1983) follows gangster
               Tony Montana and his close friend Manny Ray from their trip 
               on the Cuban Boat Lift for refugees to their arrival in Miami. 
               After killing a powerful Cuban figure, Montana and company gain 
               the ability to leave their refugee camps and roam around the U.S. 
               After unsuccessfully trying to make it legitamately in the country, 
               Montana and Ray resort to selling cocaine to dealers around the 
               world. Tony's rise is quick, but as he becomes more powerful, his
               enemies and his own paranoia begin to plague his empire.
